wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Langdon (8 January 1879 – 30 November 1944) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket for Gloucestershire between 1900 and 1914. He was born at Brighton, Sussex, and died at Nuneaton, Warwickshire.

response: The only cricketer ever to bowl a hat-trick and carry his bat in the same match was the Australian Frank Tarrant, playing for Middlesex against Gloucestershire on 26 August 1909. Tarrant hit 55 not out in his team's first innings of 145 and then dismissed Jack Board, Wilfred Brownlee and Thomas Langdon in consecutive deliveries in Gloucestershire's second innings.
He did nothing in his three subsequent games, other than to hold a catch to dismiss Thomas Langdon in his final match, against Gloucestershire in June 1913.

link_mentions.page: List of Gloucestershire County Cricket Club players

response: * Thomas Langdon (MP) for Canterbury (UK Parliament constituency)
